1363179905425563649.text: 📸Many who have rebuilt from previous disasters know this but it bears repeating: if you had a burst pipe or other home damage, take photos and keep your receipts together in case reimbursements are made available.

1363179733136080904.text: 🚱Now, water is our main concern. Boil water advisories remain for most of #TX07, low water pressure continues for most, and broken pipes are widespread. I will continue to share news on water distribution & urge all to heed boil water advisories until we are given the all-clear.

1363179539103428615.text: 🔌For many in #TX07, the power began to flicker on Thursday. Yesterday, ERCOT announced Texans should have fully restored electricity unless there are downed power lines. My colleagues & I are demanding a thorough investigation into the massive electric grid system failures.

1363179304260141059.text: This has been a difficult week for Texans. As the weather improves over the weekend, we cannot and will not forget what happened and those who suffered without electricity. Like many of you, I am frustrated—but I know we can make it through together.

1175111211601604609.text: There is certainly a role for the arbitration of disputes, and other forms of alternative dispute resolution, in our system of justice. I know this from experience. The FAIR Act and my amendment—to allow arbitration when it is optimal— recognize this role. https://t.co/Uy253QdceY

1175110944650878976.text: The FAIR Act protects the freedom to contract, the freedom of choice, and the freedom granted in our Constitution, including its Seventh Amendment. Read more here: https://t.co/9kj8JLpklb...

1175109294955671552.text: The FAIR Act is about restoring access to justice for the American people. It is for the millions of Americans who are denied their rights to seek justice and accountability today because of forced arbitration.

1175109294238371840.text: Today, the House passed the FAIR Act, which prohibits the enforcement of forced arbitration in contracts involving consumer, employment, antitrust, and civil rights disputes.

1162068299523469312.text: I join with Leader Hoyer and many of my colleagues, as well as advocates for Israel across the U.S., in calling for Prime Minister Netanyahu to reconsider and reverse this decision.

1162068233601634308.text: I have often disagreed with my colleagues’ statements about Israel, but I believe that education, engagement, and exchange of ideas is the best way to change views and resolve conflict. And working to resolve this conflict benefits us all.

1162068177704095749.text: PM Netanyahu’s decision to deny entry to Israel for members of Congress—Reps. Tlaib & Omar—not only violates its Ambassador’s promise not to deny entry to any member of Congress; it undermines the opportunity for them to gain an understanding of the complex issues in the region.

1162068120703590400.text: Visiting Israel provides an unparalleled opportunity to witness the challenges facing everyday Israelis and Palestinians, the complexities of the conflict, and the opportunities for progress. I benefited enormously from doing so just last week with a large bipartisan delegation.

1086790524663726082.text: It is time to discuss these matters with the seriousness they deserve. Time to #endtheshutdown and get to work #forthepeople.

1086790523220881409.text: Democrats have made clear we support smart, effective border security solutions: increased infrastructure investments, advanced technology to scan for contraband, more customs personnel, and more immigration judges.

1086790521815793664.text: There is much to discuss on border security matters but this is not the way to do it. We cannot run our government by shutting it down.  And we cannot protect our country by hurting the very people who have made it their life’s work to work for us.

1085673550042877959.text: I joined with my Texas colleagues in a bi-partisan letter expressing our strong opposition to any proposal that would divert disaster relief funds appropriated after Harvey and use them for any other purpose. https://t.co/gJMbxIEvdo

1085673549451415552.text: This Congress will not allow the President to grant himself extraordinary powers to divert desperately needed funding for relief, recovery, and rebuilding.

1085672907932659712.text: I will continue to fight for the additional resources that our region needs to rebuild and restore after Harvey.

1085672907240587264.text: All Americans impacted by these natural disasters deserve to know that their government will be with them now and throughout the road to recovery.

1085672906582036484.text: Today, I joined my colleagues to pass a $12.4 billion disaster relief bill to provide recovery funds for Americans devastated by hurricanes, wildfires, & other disasters, including some for us in Houston as we continue to recover from Harvey.

1085571630913474560.text: I am so inspired by my colleagues, and love how this series captures the women of the 116th Congress.  These photos are incredible.   These women are, too. https://t.co/HOy1qZpYNH

1085547751411191809.text: I want to hear from you about how the shutdown is affecting you.  Share your shutdown story here.

1085547750551441409.text: And these are just a few examples of the many heartbreaking stories we are seeing and hearing across the country.  I’m glad they took the time to talk with me.

1085547750102650881.text: I spoke with people with cases in court that are now delayed, and justice denied indefinitely.

1085547749565698048.text: I talked with TSA agents working hard and without pay – putting their neighbors’ needs ahead of their own.

1085547747237867520.text: I met with air traffic controllers in Washington and Houston to hear the impacts this shutdown has on them – now and in the future. https://t.co/slsnVkXFU6

1085547746667450368.text: One of the best ways to know how to do that is to hear from you.

1085547746151546880.text: But I do.  And I will work with my colleagues to end the shutdown and mitigate the damage in #TX07 and across the country – and we are already working on ways to do that.

1085547745702805506.text: The impacts of this shutdown are real, and lasting. And it appears that the Senate and the White House do not care.

1085547745098846208.text: There may be reasons, but they are not good reasons.  They are political reasons.  They are partisan reasons.  They are exactly the reasons I and so many others sought to join this Congress and do things differently.

1085547744490606594.text: Since then, we have continued to act to re-open government, passing multiple individual Senate Republican appropriations bills to re-open all government agencies. There is no good reason that the Senate has not done the same.

1085547743949529090.text: And, to be clear, the new Democratic House passed Senate Republican legislation to end the shutdown, re-open government and secure our borders the day we were sworn in.

1085547743458791424.text: The House has passed the legislation to re-open the government.  It is past time for the Senate to do the same.

1085547742942908417.text: Today, for the 26th day in a row, they are doing so without pay.  This is unconscionable.

1085547742397693953.text: I came to Washington to work #forthepeople, and am grateful for the federal government employees who spend their days working for the people in myriad ways every single day.

1084875780641951746.text: At @iah today and grateful for the @TSA agents, air traffic controllers, and others who put the rest of us and our safety first. We must do the same for them. It's time to #EndTheShutdown.

1083922260270956544.text: My office is aware of the situation and working to help. I will keep you updated. https://t.co/iVNdxRUtIv

1083896692670267392.text:
